text: Pi Day or Pie Approximation Day is a day when people around the world celebrate the number pi. They also eat pie to celebrate the pun as both words sound the same. Pi Day is held on March 14. ==History== On Pi Day 2004, Daniel Tammet recited 22,514 decimal digits of Ï€.Bank, Alan (March 13, 2009). "Pi Queen holds throne", Daily Pilot. Retrieved 2010-03-14. On March 14, 2010, Google made a sign celebrating Pi Day, with the word Google laid over images of circles and nothing else but pi symbols == Related days == ===Tau Day=== Tau Day is an unofficial holiday every year since 2010. It is a day to rival, or be against, pi day. Tau day is on June 28, or 06/28 as written in the American date format. == References == Category:Mathematical constants Category:March observances
title: Pi Day
